title: Early Modern Empiricism
description: This course focuses on the development of British Empiricism through the writings of John Locke, George Berkeley and David Hume. Taking the empiricist elements in Locke’s work as a point of departure, we explore how these elements are radically repurposed first by Berkeley and then by Hume to lay the foundations for what became known as early modern empiricism.
prerequisite: YCC1113 Philosophy and Political Thought 1 or with the permission of the instructor.
